title.narrative: Zambia COVID-19 Emergency Response and Health Systems Preparedness Project

activity-date.narrative: Planned start date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity

Actual end date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

description.narrative: Total Commitment in Fourth Quarter of 2020
Total Disbursement in First Quarter of 2021

condition.narrative: Financing Agreement. Schedule 2, Section I.A. 4(a) The Recipient shall not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date,recruit a Project manager to lead the implementation of Project activities, under terms of reference and with qualifications andexperience acceptable to the Association, and to coordinate with the directorate of finance, directorate of internal audit, theprocurement unit and other technical directorates within the Ministry of Health on Project implementation and adherence tofiduciary guidelines.

Financing Agreement. Schedule 2 Section I.A. 4(b) The Recipient shall not later than three (3) months after the Effective date,recruit a dedicated Project accountant, procurement specialist, monitoring and evaluation specialist, environmental specialist,social development specialist, public health specialist, and communication specialist for the Project Implementation Unit, underterms of reference and with qualification and experience acceptable to the Association.

Financing Agreement. Schedule 2 Section I.A. 4(c) The Recipient shall not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date,recruit or second an internal auditor for the Project Implementation Unit, under terms of reference and with qualification andexperience acceptable to the Association.

Financing Agreement. Schedule 2 Section III B.2 The Recipient undertakes that no Financing and/or GFF Grant proceeds or resourcesmay be used for law-enforcement, security, military, or paramilitary purposes or for any payments made to any law-enforcement,security, military, or paramilitary forces without the express approval of the Association (acting on its own behalf or asadministrator of the GFF Grant funds).

title.narrative: Preparation of Bi-annual report on project beneficiaries feed-backs and resolutions
Percentage of identified close contacts of confirmed COVID-19 cases investigated based on national guidelines.
Percentage of hospitals with functional oxygen delivery equipment
Percentage of health facilities with IPC focal person/committee
Percentage of districts with rapid response teams
Percentage of health facilities with an improved water source on premises
Number of designated laboratories with SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic capacity
Number of designated health facilities with COVID-19 case management capacity
Number of operational research studies conducted to inform the national COVID-19 response
Number of health workers trained in COVID-19 case management
Number of functioning ILI/SARI sentinel sites
People who have received essential health, nutrition, and population (HNP) services
Number of deliveries attended by skilled health personnel
Annual joint review of project implementation
Number of dedicated quarantine and isolation centers
